summary: Patricia M. Orr was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). Her name appears on multiple payroll and certification reports spanning from April 1978 to January 1979. These documents list her as an employee, along with her salary and employment dates. The documents suggest she was a staff member during the later stages of the HSCA's investigation.
significance: Patricia M. Orr's significance lies in her employment with the HSCA, indicating her involvement in the investigation of President Kennedy's assassination, although the specific nature and extent of her role are not detailed in the provided documents.
